Register.name: PSELRESET[0]
Register.description: Description collection: Mapping of the nRESET function (see POWER chapter for details)

BitField.description: GPIO pin number onto which nRESET is exposed

BitField.name: PORT
BitField.description: Port number onto which nRESET is exposed

Register.name: PSELRESET[1]
Register.description: Description collection: Mapping of the nRESET function (see POWER chapter for details)

BitField.name: PIN
BitField.description: GPIO pin number onto which nRESET is exposed

BitField.name: PORT
BitField.description: Port number onto which nRESET is exposed

Register.name: APPROTECT
Register.description: Access port protection

BitField.name: PALL
BitField.description: Enable or disable access port protection.

Enum.name: Disabled
Enum.description: Hardware disable of access port protection for devices where access port protection is controlled by hardware

Enum.name: HwDisabled
Enum.description: Hardware disable of access port protection for devices where access port protection is controlled by hardware and software

Register.name: NFCPINS
Register.description: Setting of pins dedicated to NFC functionality: NFC antenna or GPIO

BitField.name: PROTECT
BitField.description: Setting of pins dedicated to NFC functionality

Enum.name: Disabled
Enum.description: Operation as GPIO pins. Same protection as normal GPIO pins.

Enum.name: NFC
Enum.description: Operation as NFC antenna pins. Configures the protection for NFC operation.

Register.name: DEBUGCTRL
Register.description: Processor debug control

BitField.name: CPUNIDEN
BitField.description: Configure CPU non-intrusive debug features

Enum.name: Enabled
Enum.description: Enable CPU ITM and ETM functionality (default behavior)

Enum.name: Disabled
Enum.description: Disable CPU ITM and ETM functionality

BitField.name: CPUFPBEN
BitField.description: Configure CPU flash patch and breakpoint (FPB) unit behavior

Enum.name: Disabled
Enum.description: Disable CPU FPB unit. Writes into the FPB registers will be ignored.

Register.name: REGOUT0
Register.description: Output voltage from REG0 regulator stage. The maximum output voltage from this stage is given as VDDH - V_VDDH-VDD.

BitField.name: VOUT
BitField.description: Output voltage from REG0 regulator stage.

Register.name: FORCEPROTECT
Register.description: Software force enable APPROTECT mechanism until next reset.

BitField.name: FORCEPROTECT
BitField.description: Write 0x0 to force enable APPROTECT mechanism

Register.name: DISABLE
Register.description: Software disable APPROTECT mechanism

BitField.name: DISABLE
BitField.description: Software disable APPROTECT mechanism

Register.name: INTENSET
Register.description: Enable interrupt

BitField.name: HFCLKSTARTED
BitField.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event HFCLKSTARTED

BitField.name: LFCLKSTARTED
BitField.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event LFCLKSTARTED

BitField.name: DONE
BitField.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event DONE

BitField.name: CTTO
BitField.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event CTTO

BitField.name: CTSTARTED
BitField.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event CTSTARTED

BitField.name: CTSTOPPED
BitField.description: Write '1' to enable interrupt for event CTSTOPPED

Register.name: INTENCLR
Register.description: Disable interrupt

BitField.name: HFCLKSTARTED
BitField.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event HFCLKSTARTED

BitField.name: LFCLKSTARTED
BitField.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event LFCLKSTARTED

BitField.name: DONE
BitField.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event DONE

BitField.name: CTTO
BitField.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event CTTO

BitField.name: CTSTARTED
BitField.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event CTSTARTED

BitField.name: CTSTOPPED
BitField.description: Write '1' to disable interrupt for event CTSTOPPED

Register.name: HFCLKRUN
Register.description: Status indicating that HFCLKSTART task has been triggered

BitField.name: STATUS
BitField.description: HFCLKSTART task triggered or not

Register.name: HFCLKSTAT
Register.description: HFCLK status

BitField.name: SRC
BitField.description: Source of HFCLK

BitField.name: STATE
BitField.description: HFCLK state

Register.name: LFCLKRUN
Register.description: Status indicating that LFCLKSTART task has been triggered

BitField.name: STATUS
BitField.description: LFCLKSTART task triggered or not

Register.name: LFCLKSTAT
Register.description: LFCLK status

BitField.name: SRC
BitField.description: Source of LFCLK

BitField.name: STATE
BitField.description: LFCLK state

Register.name: LFCLKSRCCOPY
Register.description: Copy of LFCLKSRC register, set when LFCLKSTART task was triggered

BitField.name: SRC
BitField.description: Clock source

Register.name: LFCLKSRC
Register.description: Clock source for the LFCLK

BitField.name: SRC
BitField.description: Clock source

BitField.name: BYPASS
BitField.description: Enable or disable bypass of LFCLK crystal oscillator with external clock source

Enum.name: Disabled
Enum.description: Disable (use with Xtal or low-swing external source)

BitField.name: EXTERNAL
BitField.description: Enable or disable external source for LFCLK

Enum.name: Enabled
Enum.description: Enable use of external source instead of Xtal (SRC needs to be set to Xtal)

Register.name: HFXODEBOUNCE
Register.description: HFXO debounce time. The HFXO is started by triggering the TASKS_HFCLKSTART task.

BitField.name: HFXODEBOUNCE
BitField.description: HFXO debounce time. Debounce time = HFXODEBOUNCE * 16 us.

Enum.name: Db256us
Enum.description: 256 us debounce time. Recommended for TSX-3225, FA-20H and FA-128 crystals.

Enum.name: Db1024us
Enum.description: 1024 us debounce time. Recommended for NX1612AA and NX1210AB crystals.

Register.name: CTIV
Register.description: Calibration timer interval

BitField.name: CTIV
BitField.description: Calibration timer interval in multiple of 0.25 seconds. Range: 0.25 seconds to 31.75 seconds.

Register.name: TRACECONFIG
Register.description: Clocking options for the trace port debug interface

BitField.name: TRACEPORTSPEED
BitField.description: Speed of trace port clock. Note that the TRACECLK pin will output this clock divided by two.

BitField.name: TRACEMUX
BitField.description: Pin multiplexing of trace signals. See pin assignment chapter for more details.

Enum.name: GPIO
Enum.description: No trace signals routed to pins. All pins can be used as regular GPIOs.

Enum.name: Serial
Enum.description: SWO trace signal routed to pin. Remaining pins can be used as regular GPIOs.

Enum.name: Parallel
Enum.description: All trace signals (TRACECLK and TRACEDATA[n]) routed to pins.

Register.name: LFRCMODE
Register.description: LFRC mode configuration

BitField.name: MODE
BitField.description: Set LFRC mode

BitField.name: STATUS
BitField.description: Active LFRC mode. This field is read only.

Register.name: TASKS_CONSTLAT
Register.description: Enable Constant Latency mode

BitField.name: TASKS_CONSTLAT
BitField.description: Enable Constant Latency mode

Register.name: RESETREAS
Register.description: Reset reason

BitField.name: RESETPIN
BitField.description: Reset from pin-reset detected

BitField.name: DOG
BitField.description: Reset from watchdog detected

BitField.name: SREQ
BitField.description: Reset from soft reset detected

BitField.name: LOCKUP
BitField.description: Reset from CPU lock-up detected

BitField.name: OFF
BitField.description: Reset due to wake up from System OFF mode when wakeup is triggered from DETECT signal from GPIO

BitField.name: LPCOMP
BitField.description: Reset due to wake up from System OFF mode when wakeup is triggered from ANADETECT signal from LPCOMP

BitField.name: DIF
BitField.description: Reset due to wake up from System OFF mode when wakeup is triggered from entering into debug interface mode

BitField.name: NFC
BitField.description: Reset due to wake up from System OFF mode by NFC field detect

BitField.name: VBUS
BitField.description: Reset due to wake up from System OFF mode by VBUS rising into valid range

Register.name: RAMSTATUS
Register.description: Deprecated register - RAM status register

BitField.name: RAMBLOCK0
BitField.description: RAM block 0 is on or off/powering up

BitField.name: RAMBLOCK1
BitField.description: RAM block 1 is on or off/powering up

BitField.name: RAMBLOCK2
BitField.description: RAM block 2 is on or off/powering up

BitField.name: RAMBLOCK3
BitField.description: RAM block 3 is on or off/powering up

Register.name: USBREGSTATUS
Register.description: USB supply status

BitField.name: VBUSDETECT
BitField.description: VBUS input detection status (USBDETECTED and USBREMOVED events are derived from this information)

BitField.name: OUTPUTRDY
BitField.description: USB supply output settling time elapsed

Enum.name: NotReady
Enum.description: USBREG output settling time not elapsed

Enum.name: Ready
Enum.description: USBREG output settling time elapsed (same information as USBPWRRDY event)

Register.name: SYSTEMOFF
Register.description: System OFF register

BitField.name: SYSTEMOFF
BitField.description: Enable System OFF mode

Register.name: POFCON
Register.description: Power-fail comparator configuration

BitField.name: POF
BitField.description: Enable or disable power failure warning

BitField.name: THRESHOLD
BitField.description: Power-fail comparator threshold setting. This setting applies both for normal voltage mode (supply connected to both VDD and VDDH) and high voltage mode (supply connected to VDDH only). Values 0-3 set threshold below 1.7 V and should not be used as brown out detection will be activated before power failure warning on such low voltages.

BitField.name: THRESHOLDVDDH
BitField.description: Power-fail comparator threshold setting for high voltage mode (supply connected to VDDH only). This setting does not apply for normal voltage mode (supply connected to both VDD and VDDH).

Enum.description: High voltage mode. Voltage supplied on VDDH.

Register.name: IFTIMING.RXDELAY
Register.description: Sample delay for input serial data on MISO

BitField.name: RXDELAY
BitField.description: Sample delay for input serial data on MISO. The value specifies the number of 64 MHz clock cycles (15.625 ns) delay from the the sampling edge of SCK (leading edge for CONFIG.CPHA = 0, trailing edge for CONFIG.CPHA = 1) until the input serial data is sampled. As en example, if RXDELAY = 0 and CONFIG.CPHA = 0, the input serial data is sampled on the rising edge of SCK.

Register.name: IFTIMING.CSNDUR
Register.description: Minimum duration between edge of CSN and edge of SCK and minimum duration CSN must stay high between transactions

BitField.name: CSNDUR
BitField.description: Minimum duration between edge of CSN and edge of SCK and minimum duration CSN must stay high between transactions. The value is specified in number of 64 MHz clock cycles (15.625 ns).

BitField.name: DCXCNT
BitField.description: This register specifies the number of command bytes preceding the data bytes. The PSEL.DCX line will be low during transmission of command bytes and high during transmission of data bytes. Value 0xF indicates that all bytes are command bytes.

Register.name: IFTIMING.RXDELAY
Register.description: Sample delay for input serial data on MISO

BitField.name: RXDELAY
BitField.description: Sample delay for input serial data on MISO. The value specifies the number of 64 MHz clock cycles (15.625 ns) delay from the the sampling edge of SCK (leading edge for CONFIG.CPHA = 0, trailing edge for CONFIG.CPHA = 1) until the input serial data is sampled. As en example, if RXDELAY = 0 and CONFIG.CPHA = 0, the input serial data is sampled on the rising edge of SCK.

Register.name: IFTIMING.CSNDUR
Register.description: Minimum duration between edge of CSN and edge of SCK and minimum duration CSN must stay high between transactions

BitField.name: CSNDUR
BitField.description: Minimum duration between edge of CSN and edge of SCK and minimum duration CSN must stay high between transactions. The value is specified in number of 64 MHz clock cycles (15.625 ns).

BitField.name: CSNPOL

BitField.description: This register specifies the number of command bytes preceding the data bytes. The PSEL.DCX line will be low during transmission of command bytes and high during transmission of data bytes. Value 0xF indicates that all bytes are command bytes.

BitField.name: CRCMODETX
BitField.description: CRC mode for outgoing frames

Enum.name: NoCRCTX
Enum.description: CRC is not added to the frame

Enum.name: CRC16TX
Enum.description: 16 bit CRC added to the frame based on all the data read from RAM that is used in the frame

Register.name: TXD.AMOUNT
Register.description: Size of outgoing frame

BitField.name: TXDATABITS
BitField.description: Number of bits in the last or first byte read from RAM that shall be included in the frame (excluding parity bit).

BitField.name: TXDATABYTES
BitField.description: Number of complete bytes that shall be included in the frame, excluding CRC, parity and framing

Register.name: RXD.FRAMECONFIG
Register.description: Configuration of incoming frames

BitField.name: PARITY
BitField.description: Indicates if parity expected in RX frame

Enum.name: NoParity
Enum.description: Parity is not expected in RX frames

Enum.name: Parity
Enum.description: Parity is expected in RX frames

BitField.name: SOF
BitField.description: SoF expected or not in RX frames

Enum.name: NoSoF
Enum.description: SoF symbol is not expected in RX frames

Enum.name: SoF
Enum.description: SoF symbol is expected in RX frames

BitField.name: CRCMODERX
BitField.description: CRC mode for incoming frames

Enum.name: NoCRCRX
Enum.description: CRC is not expected in RX frames

Enum.name: CRC16RX
Enum.description: Last 16 bits in RX frame is CRC, CRC is checked and CRCSTATUS updated

Register.name: RXD.AMOUNT
Register.description: Size of last incoming frame

BitField.name: RXDATABITS
BitField.description: Number of bits in the last byte in the frame, if less than 8 (including CRC, but excluding parity and SoF/EoF framing).

BitField.name: RXDATABYTES
BitField.description: Number of complete bytes received in the frame (including CRC, but excluding parity and SoF/EoF framing)

Register.name: NFCID1_LAST
Register.description: Last NFCID1 part (4, 7 or 10 bytes ID)

BitField.name: NFCID1_Z
BitField.description: NFCID1 byte Z (very last byte sent)

BitField.name: NFCID1_Y
BitField.description: NFCID1 byte Y

BitField.name: NFCID1_X
BitField.description: NFCID1 byte X

BitField.name: NFCID1_W
BitField.description: NFCID1 byte W

Register.name: NFCID1_2ND_LAST
Register.description: Second last NFCID1 part (7 or 10 bytes ID)

BitField.name: NFCID1_V
BitField.description: NFCID1 byte V

BitField.name: NFCID1_U
BitField.description: NFCID1 byte U

BitField.name: NFCID1_T
BitField.description: NFCID1 byte T

Register.name: NFCID1_3RD_LAST
Register.description: Third last NFCID1 part (10 bytes ID)

BitField.name: NFCID1_S
BitField.description: NFCID1 byte S

BitField.name: NFCID1_R
BitField.description: NFCID1 byte R

BitField.name: NFCID1_Q
BitField.description: NFCID1 byte Q

Register.name: AUTOCOLRESCONFIG
Register.description: Controls the auto collision resolution function. This setting must be done before the NFCT peripheral is activated.

BitField.name: MODE
BitField.description: Enables/disables auto collision resolution

Register.name: SENSRES
Register.description: NFC-A SENS_RES auto-response settings

BitField.name: BITFRAMESDD
BitField.description: Bit frame SDD as defined by the b5:b1 of byte 1 in SENS_RES response in the NFC Forum, NFC Digital Protocol Technical Specification

BitField.name: RFU5
BitField.description: Reserved for future use. Shall be 0.

BitField.name: NFCIDSIZE
BitField.description: NFCID1 size. This value is used by the auto collision resolution engine.

BitField.name: PLATFCONFIG
BitField.description: Tag platform configuration as defined by the b4:b1 of byte 2 in SENS_RES response in the NFC Forum, NFC Digital Protocol Technical Specification

BitField.name: RFU74
BitField.description: Reserved for future use. Shall be 0.

Register.name: SELRES
Register.description: NFC-A SEL_RES auto-response settings

BitField.name: RFU10
BitField.description: Reserved for future use. Shall be 0.

BitField.name: CASCADE
BitField.description: Cascade as defined by the b3 of SEL_RES response in the NFC Forum, NFC Digital Protocol Technical Specification (controlled by hardware, shall be 0)

BitField.name: RFU43
BitField.description: Reserved for future use. Shall be 0.

BitField.name: PROTOCOL
BitField.description: Protocol as defined by the b7:b6 of SEL_RES response in the NFC Forum, NFC Digital Protocol Technical Specification

BitField.name: RFU7
BitField.description: Reserved for future use. Shall be 0.

Register.name: CONFIG[0]
Register.description: Description collection: Configuration for OUT[n], SET[n], and CLR[n] tasks and IN[n] event

Enum.name: Disabled
Enum.description: Disabled. Pin specified by PSEL will not be acquired by the GPIOTE module.

BitField.name: PSEL
BitField.description: GPIO number associated with SET[n], CLR[n], and OUT[n] tasks and IN[n] event

BitField.name: PORT
BitField.description: Port number

BitField.name: POLARITY
BitField.description: When In task mode: Operation to be performed on output when OUT[n] task is triggered. When In event mode: Operation on input that shall trigger IN[n] event.

Enum.name: None
Enum.description: Task mode: No effect on pin from OUT[n] task. Event mode: no IN[n] event generated on pin activity.

Enum.name: LoToHi
Enum.description: Task mode: Set pin from OUT[n] task. Event mode: Generate IN[n] event when rising edge on pin.

Enum.name: HiToLo
Enum.description: Task mode: Clear pin from OUT[n] task. Event mode: Generate IN[n] event when falling edge on pin.

Enum.name: Toggle
Enum.description: Task mode: Toggle pin from OUT[n]. Event mode: Generate IN[n] when any change on pin.

BitField.name: OUTINIT
BitField.description: When in task mode: Initial value of the output when the GPIOTE channel is configured. When in event mode: No effect.

Enum.name: Low
Enum.description: Task mode: Initial value of pin before task triggering is low

Enum.name: High
Enum.description: Task mode: Initial value of pin before task triggering is high

Enum.description: Task mode: Initial value of pin before task triggering is low

Enum.name: High
Enum.description: Task mode: Initial value of pin before task triggering is high

Register.description: Description cluster: Input negative pin selection for CH[n]

BitField.description: Negative channel resistor control

BitField.description: Reference control

BitField.description: Enable differential mode

Enum.description: Single-ended, PSELN will be ignored, negative input to SAADC shorted to GND

Register.name: MODE
Register.description: Operation mode

BitField.description: The mode of operation to be used. Settings in this register apply whenever either the KSGEN task or the CRYPT task is triggered.

BitField.name: DATARATE
BitField.description: Radio data rate that the CCM shall run synchronous with

BitField.name: LENGTH
BitField.description: Packet length configuration

Enum.name: Default
Enum.description: Default length. Effective length of LENGTH field in encrypted/decrypted packet is 5 bits. A keystream for packet payloads up to 27 bytes will be generated.

Enum.name: Extended
Enum.description: Extended length. Effective length of LENGTH field in encrypted/decrypted packet is 8 bits. A keystream for packet payloads up to MAXPACKETSIZE bytes will be generated.

Register.name: TASKS_STOP
Register.description: Stops PWM pulse generation on all channels at the end of current PWM period, and stops sequence playback

BitField.name: TASKS_STOP
BitField.description: Stops PWM pulse generation on all channels at the end of current PWM period, and stops sequence playback

Register.name: TASKS_SEQSTART[0]
Register.description: Description collection: Loads the first PWM value on all enabled channels from sequence n, and starts playing that sequence at the rate defined in SEQ[n]REFRESH and/or DECODER.MODE. Causes PWM generation to start if not running.

BitField.name: TASKS_SEQSTART
BitField.description: Loads the first PWM value on all enabled channels from sequence n, and starts playing that sequence at the rate defined in SEQ[n]REFRESH and/or DECODER.MODE. Causes PWM generation to start if not running.

Register.name: TASKS_SEQSTART[1]
Register.description: Description collection: Loads the first PWM value on all enabled channels from sequence n, and starts playing that sequence at the rate defined in SEQ[n]REFRESH and/or DECODER.MODE. Causes PWM generation to start if not running.

BitField.name: TASKS_SEQSTART
BitField.description: Loads the first PWM value on all enabled channels from sequence n, and starts playing that sequence at the rate defined in SEQ[n]REFRESH and/or DECODER.MODE. Causes PWM generation to start if not running.

Register.name: TASKS_NEXTSTEP
Register.description: Steps by one value in the current sequence on all enabled channels if DECODER.MODE=NextStep. Does not cause PWM generation to start if not running.

BitField.name: TASKS_NEXTSTEP
BitField.description: Steps by one value in the current sequence on all enabled channels if DECODER.MODE=NextStep. Does not cause PWM generation to start if not running.

Enum.description: Up and down counter, center-aligned PWM duty cycle

Register.name: COUNTERTOP
Register.description: Value up to which the pulse generator counter counts

BitField.name: COUNTERTOP
BitField.description: Value up to which the pulse generator counter counts. This register is ignored when DECODER.MODE=WaveForm and only values from RAM are used.

Register.name: PRESCALER
Register.description: Configuration for PWM_CLK

BitField.name: PRESCALER
BitField.description: Prescaler of PWM_CLK

Register.name: DECODER
Register.description: Configuration of the decoder

BitField.name: LOAD
BitField.description: How a sequence is read from RAM and spread to the compare register

Enum.name: Common
Enum.description: 1st half word (16-bit) used in all PWM channels 0..3

Enum.name: Grouped
Enum.description: 1st half word (16-bit) used in channel 0..1; 2nd word in channel 2..3

Enum.name: Individual
Enum.description: 1st half word (16-bit) in ch.0; 2nd in ch.1; ...; 4th in ch.3

Enum.name: WaveForm
Enum.description: 1st half word (16-bit) in ch.0; 2nd in ch.1; ...; 4th in COUNTERTOP

BitField.name: MODE
BitField.description: Selects source for advancing the active sequence

Enum.name: RefreshCount

Enum.name: NextStep

Register.description: PDM module enable register

BitField.description: Enable or disable PDM module

Register.name: PDMCLKCTRL
Register.description: PDM clock generator control

BitField.name: FREQ
BitField.description: PDM_CLK frequency configuration

Enum.name: Default
Enum.description: PDM_CLK = 32 MHz / 31 = 1.032 MHz. Nominal clock for RATIO=Ratio64.

Enum.name: 1280K
Enum.description: PDM_CLK = 32 MHz / 25 = 1.280 MHz. Nominal clock for RATIO=Ratio80.

Register.name: MODE
Register.description: Defines the routing of the connected PDM microphones' signals

BitField.name: OPERATION
BitField.description: Mono or stereo operation

Enum.name: Stereo
Enum.description: Sample and store one pair (left + right) of 16-bit samples per RAM word R=[31:16]; L=[15:0]

Enum.name: Mono
Enum.description: Sample and store two successive left samples (16 bits each) per RAM word L1=[31:16]; L0=[15:0]

BitField.name: EDGE
BitField.description: Defines on which PDM_CLK edge left (or mono) is sampled

Enum.name: LeftFalling
Enum.description: Left (or mono) is sampled on falling edge of PDM_CLK

Enum.name: LeftRising
Enum.description: Left (or mono) is sampled on rising edge of PDM_CLK

Register.name: GAINL
Register.description: Left output gain adjustment

BitField.name: GAINL
BitField.description: Left output gain adjustment, in 0.5 dB steps, around the default module gain (see electrical parameters) 0x00 -20 dB gain adjust 0x01 -19.5 dB gain adjust (...) 0x27 -0.5 dB gain adjust 0x28 0 dB gain adjust 0x29 +0.5 dB gain adjust (...) 0x4F +19.5 dB gain adjust 0x50 +20 dB gain adjust

Register.name: GAINR
Register.description: Right output gain adjustment

BitField.name: GAINR
BitField.description: Right output gain adjustment, in 0.5 dB steps, around the default module gain (see electrical parameters)

Register.name: RATIO
Register.description: Selects the ratio between PDM_CLK and output sample rate. Change PDMCLKCTRL accordingly.

BitField.name: RATIO
BitField.description: Selects the ratio between PDM_CLK and output sample rate

BitField.name: BUFFSIZE

Register.name: ACL[0].ADDR
Register.description: Description cluster: Start address of region to protect. The start address must be word-aligned.

BitField.name: ADDR
BitField.description: Start address of flash region n. The start address must point to a flash page boundary.

Register.name: ACL[0].SIZE
Register.description: Description cluster: Size of region to protect counting from address ACL[n].ADDR. Writing a '0' has no effect.

BitField.name: SIZE
BitField.description: Size of flash region n in bytes. Must be a multiple of the flash page size.

Register.name: ACL[0].PERM
Register.description: Description cluster: Access permissions for region n as defined by start address ACL[n].ADDR and size ACL[n].SIZE

BitField.description: Configure write and erase permissions for region n. Writing a '0' has no effect.

Enum.description: Block write and erase instructions to region n.

Register.name: CONFIG
Register.description: Configuration register

BitField.name: WEN
BitField.description: Program memory access mode. It is strongly recommended to only activate erase and write modes when they are actively used. Enabling write or erase will invalidate the cache and keep it invalidated.

Register.name: ERASEPAGE
Register.description: Register for erasing a page in code area

BitField.description: Register for starting erase of a page in code area

BitField.description: Register for erasing a page in code area, equivalent to ERASEPAGE

Register.name: ERASEALL
Register.description: Register for erasing all non-volatile user memory

BitField.name: ERASEALL
BitField.description: Erase all non-volatile memory including UICR registers. The erase must be enabled using CONFIG.WEN before the non-volatile memory can be erased.

Register.name: ERASEPCR0
Register.description: Deprecated register - Register for erasing a page in code area, equivalent to ERASEPAGE

BitField.name: ERASEPCR0
BitField.description: Register for starting erase of a page in code area, equivalent to ERASEPAGE

Register.name: ERASEUICR
Register.description: Register for erasing user information configuration registers

BitField.name: ERASEUICR
BitField.description: Register starting erase of all user information configuration registers. The erase must be enabled using CONFIG.WEN before the UICR can be erased.

Register.name: ERASEPAGEPARTIAL
Register.description: Register for partial erase of a page in code area

BitField.name: ERASEPAGEPARTIAL
BitField.description: Register for starting partial erase of a page in code area

Register.name: ERASEPAGEPARTIALCFG
Register.description: Register for partial erase configuration

BitField.name: DURATION
BitField.description: Duration of the partial erase in milliseconds

Register.name: ICACHECNF
Register.description: I-code cache configuration register

BitField.name: CACHEEN
BitField.description: Cache enable

Enum.name: Disabled
Enum.description: Disable cache. Invalidates all cache entries.

BitField.name: CACHEPROFEN
BitField.description: Cache profiling enable

Register.name: IHIT
Register.description: I-code cache hit counter

BitField.name: HITS
BitField.description: Number of cache hits. Register is writable, but only to '0'.

Register.name: IMISS
Register.description: I-code cache miss counter

BitField.name: MISSES
BitField.description: Number of cache misses. Register is writable, but only to '0'.

Register.name: TASKS_STOP
Register.description: Stops PWM pulse generation on all channels at the end of current PWM period, and stops sequence playback

BitField.name: TASKS_STOP
BitField.description: Stops PWM pulse generation on all channels at the end of current PWM period, and stops sequence playback

Register.name: TASKS_SEQSTART[0]
Register.description: Description collection: Loads the first PWM value on all enabled channels from sequence n, and starts playing that sequence at the rate defined in SEQ[n]REFRESH and/or DECODER.MODE. Causes PWM generation to start if not running.

BitField.name: TASKS_SEQSTART
BitField.description: Loads the first PWM value on all enabled channels from sequence n, and starts playing that sequence at the rate defined in SEQ[n]REFRESH and/or DECODER.MODE. Causes PWM generation to start if not running.

Register.name: TASKS_SEQSTART[1]
Register.description: Description collection: Loads the first PWM value on all enabled channels from sequence n, and starts playing that sequence at the rate defined in SEQ[n]REFRESH and/or DECODER.MODE. Causes PWM generation to start if not running.

BitField.name: TASKS_SEQSTART
BitField.description: Loads the first PWM value on all enabled channels from sequence n, and starts playing that sequence at the rate defined in SEQ[n]REFRESH and/or DECODER.MODE. Causes PWM generation to start if not running.

Register.name: TASKS_NEXTSTEP
Register.description: Steps by one value in the current sequence on all enabled channels if DECODER.MODE=NextStep. Does not cause PWM generation to start if not running.

BitField.name: TASKS_NEXTSTEP
BitField.description: Steps by one value in the current sequence on all enabled channels if DECODER.MODE=NextStep. Does not cause PWM generation to start if not running.

Register.name: MODE
Register.description: Selects operating mode of the wave counter

BitField.name: UPDOWN
BitField.description: Selects up mode or up-and-down mode for the counter

Enum.name: Up
Enum.description: Up counter, edge-aligned PWM duty cycle

Enum.name: UpAndDown
Enum.description: Up and down counter, center-aligned PWM duty cycle

Register.name: COUNTERTOP
Register.description: Value up to which the pulse generator counter counts

BitField.name: COUNTERTOP
BitField.description: Value up to which the pulse generator counter counts. This register is ignored when DECODER.MODE=WaveForm and only values from RAM are used.

Register.name: PRESCALER
Register.description: Configuration for PWM_CLK

BitField.name: PRESCALER
BitField.description: Prescaler of PWM_CLK

Register.name: DECODER
Register.description: Configuration of the decoder

BitField.name: LOAD
BitField.description: How a sequence is read from RAM and spread to the compare register

Enum.name: Common
Enum.description: 1st half word (16-bit) used in all PWM channels 0..3

Enum.name: Grouped
Enum.description: 1st half word (16-bit) used in channel 0..1; 2nd word in channel 2..3

Enum.name: Individual
Enum.description: 1st half word (16-bit) in ch.0; 2nd in ch.1; ...; 4th in ch.3

Enum.name: WaveForm
Enum.description: 1st half word (16-bit) in ch.0; 2nd in ch.1; ...; 4th in COUNTERTOP

BitField.name: MODE
BitField.description: Selects source for advancing the active sequence

Enum.name: RefreshCount
Enum.description: SEQ[n].REFRESH is used to determine loading internal compare registers

Enum.name: NextStep
Enum.description: NEXTSTEP task causes a new value to be loaded to internal compare registers

Register.name: LOOP
Register.description: Number of playbacks of a loop

BitField.name: CNT
BitField.description: Number of playbacks of pattern cycles

Enum.name: Disabled
Enum.description: Looping disabled (stop at the end of the sequence)

Register.name: TASKS_SEQSTART[0]
Register.description: Description collection: Loads the first PWM value on all enabled channels from sequence n, and starts playing that sequence at the rate defined in SEQ[n]REFRESH and/or DECODER.MODE. Causes PWM generation to start if not running.

BitField.name: TASKS_SEQSTART
BitField.description: Loads the first PWM value on all enabled channels from sequence n, and starts playing that sequence at the rate defined in SEQ[n]REFRESH and/or DECODER.MODE. Causes PWM generation to start if not running.

Register.name: TASKS_SEQSTART[1]

BitField.name: TASKS_SEQSTART
BitField.description: Loads the first PWM value on all enabled channels from sequence n, and starts playing that sequence at the rate defined in SEQ[n]REFRESH and/or DECODER.MODE. Causes PWM generation to start if not running.

Register.name: IFTIMING.RXDELAY
Register.description: Sample delay for input serial data on MISO

BitField.name: RXDELAY
BitField.description: Sample delay for input serial data on MISO. The value specifies the number of 64 MHz clock cycles (15.625 ns) delay from the the sampling edge of SCK (leading edge for CONFIG.CPHA = 0, trailing edge for CONFIG.CPHA = 1) until the input serial data is sampled. As en example, if RXDELAY = 0 and CONFIG.CPHA = 0, the input serial data is sampled on the rising edge of SCK.

Register.name: IFTIMING.CSNDUR
Register.description: Minimum duration between edge of CSN and edge of SCK and minimum duration CSN must stay high between transactions

BitField.name: CSNDUR
BitField.description: Minimum duration between edge of CSN and edge of SCK and minimum duration CSN must stay high between transactions. The value is specified in number of 64 MHz clock cycles (15.625 ns).

Register.name: TASKS_START
Register.description: Starts continuous I2S transfer. Also starts MCK generator when this is enabled.

BitField.name: TASKS_START
BitField.description: Starts continuous I2S transfer. Also starts MCK generator when this is enabled.

Register.name: TASKS_STOP
Register.description: Stops I2S transfer. Also stops MCK generator. Triggering this task will cause the STOPPED event to be generated.

BitField.name: TASKS_STOP
BitField.description: Stops I2S transfer. Also stops MCK generator. Triggering this task will cause the STOPPED event to be generated.

Register.name: EVENTS_RXPTRUPD
Register.description: The RXD.PTR register has been copied to internal double-buffers. When the I2S module is started and RX is enabled, this event will be generated for every RXTXD.MAXCNT words that are received on the SDIN pin.

BitField.name: EVENTS_RXPTRUPD
BitField.description: The RXD.PTR register has been copied to internal double-buffers. When the I2S module is started and RX is enabled, this event will be generated for every RXTXD.MAXCNT words that are received on the SDIN pin.

Register.name: EVENTS_STOPPED
Register.description: I2S transfer stopped.

BitField.name: EVENTS_STOPPED
BitField.description: I2S transfer stopped.

Register.name: EVENTS_TXPTRUPD
Register.description: The TDX.PTR register has been copied to internal double-buffers. When the I2S module is started and TX is enabled, this event will be generated for every RXTXD.MAXCNT words that are sent on the SDOUT pin.

BitField.name: EVENTS_TXPTRUPD
BitField.description: The TDX.PTR register has been copied to internal double-buffers. When the I2S module is started and TX is enabled, this event will be generated for every RXTXD.MAXCNT words that are sent on the SDOUT pin.

Register.name: ENABLE
Register.description: Enable I2S module.

BitField.name: ENABLE
BitField.description: Enable I2S module.

Register.name: CONFIG.MODE
Register.description: I2S mode.

BitField.name: MODE
BitField.description: I2S mode.

Enum.name: Master
Enum.description: Master mode. SCK and LRCK generated from internal master clcok (MCK) and output on pins defined by PSEL.xxx.

Enum.name: Slave
Enum.description: Slave mode. SCK and LRCK generated by external master and received on pins defined by PSEL.xxx

Register.name: CONFIG.RXEN
Register.description: Reception (RX) enable.

BitField.name: RXEN
BitField.description: Reception (RX) enable.

Enum.name: Disabled
Enum.description: Reception disabled and now data will be written to the RXD.PTR address.

Register.name: CONFIG.TXEN
Register.description: Transmission (TX) enable.

BitField.name: TXEN
BitField.description: Transmission (TX) enable.

Enum.name: Disabled
Enum.description: Transmission disabled and now data will be read from the RXD.TXD address.

Register.name: CONFIG.MCKEN
Register.description: Master clock generator enable.

BitField.name: MCKEN
BitField.description: Master clock generator enable.

Enum.name: Disabled
Enum.description: Master clock generator disabled and PSEL.MCK not connected(available as GPIO).

Enum.name: Enabled
Enum.description: Master clock generator running and MCK output on PSEL.MCK.

Register.name: CONFIG.MCKFREQ
Register.description: Master clock generator frequency.

BitField.name: MCKFREQ
BitField.description: Master clock generator frequency.

Register.name: CONFIG.RATIO

BitField.name: RATIO
BitField.description: MCK / LRCK ratio.

BitField.description: Enable channels.

Register.name: RXD.PTR
Register.description: Receive buffer RAM start address.

BitField.name: PTR
BitField.description: Receive buffer Data RAM start address. When receiving, words containing samples will be written to this address. This address is a word aligned Data RAM address.

Register.name: TXD.PTR
Register.description: Transmit buffer RAM start address.

BitField.name: PTR
BitField.description: Transmit buffer Data RAM start address. When transmitting, words containing samples will be fetched from this address. This address is a word aligned Data RAM address.

Register.name: RXTXD.MAXCNT
Register.description: Size of RXD and TXD buffers.

BitField.name: MAXCNT
BitField.description: Size of RXD and TXD buffers in number of 32 bit words.

BitField.description: Select bulk endpoint number

BitField.name: IO
BitField.description: Selects IN or OUT endpoint

BitField.name: VALUE
BitField.description: Data toggle value

Enum.description: No action on data toggle when writing the register with this value

Enum.name: Data0
Enum.description: Data toggle is DATA0 on endpoint set by EP and IO

Enum.name: Data1
Enum.description: Data toggle is DATA1 on endpoint set by EP and IO

Register.name: ISOSPLIT
Register.description: Controls the split of ISO buffers

BitField.name: SPLIT
BitField.description: Controls the split of ISO buffers

Enum.description: Full buffer dedicated to either ISO IN or OUT

Register.name: FRAMECNTR
Register.description: Returns the current value of the start of frame counter

BitField.name: FRAMECNTR
BitField.description: Returns the current value of the start of frame counter

Register.name: LOWPOWER
Register.description: Controls USBD peripheral low power mode during USB suspend

BitField.name: LOWPOWER
BitField.description: Controls USBD peripheral low-power mode during USB suspend

Enum.name: ForceNormal
Enum.description: Software must write this value to exit low power mode and before performing a remote wake-up

Enum.name: LowPower
Enum.description: Software must write this value to enter low power mode after DMA and software have finished interacting with the USB peripheral

Register.name: ISOINCONFIG
Register.description: Controls the response of the ISO IN endpoint to an IN token when no data is ready to be sent

BitField.name: RESPONSE
BitField.description: Controls the response of the ISO IN endpoint to an IN token when no data is ready to be sent

Enum.name: NoResp
Enum.description: Endpoint does not respond in that case

Enum.name: ZeroData
Enum.description: Endpoint responds with a zero-length data packet in that case

Register.description: Address offset into the external memory for Execute in Place operation.

BitField.name: XIPOFFSET
BitField.description: Address offset into the external memory for Execute in Place operation. Value must be a multiple of 4.

Register.name: IFCONFIG0
Register.description: Interface configuration.

BitField.name: READOC
BitField.description: Configure number of data lines and opcode used for reading.

BitField.name: WRITEOC
BitField.description: Configure number of data lines and opcode used for writing.

BitField.name: ADDRMODE
BitField.description: Addressing mode.

BitField.name: DPMENABLE
BitField.description: Enable deep power-down mode (DPM) feature.

BitField.name: PPSIZE
BitField.description: Page size for commands PP, PP2O, PP4O and PP4IO.

Register.name: IFCONFIG1
Register.description: Interface configuration.

BitField.name: SCKDELAY
BitField.description: Minimum amount of time that the CSN pin must stay high before it can go low again. Value is specified in number of 16 MHz periods (62.5 ns).

BitField.name: DPMEN
BitField.description: Enter/exit deep power-down mode (DPM) for external flash memory.

BitField.name: SPIMODE
BitField.description: Select SPI mode.

Enum.name: MODE0
Enum.description: Mode 0: Data are captured on the clock rising edge and data is output on a falling edge. Base level of clock is 0 (CPOL=0, CPHA=0).

Enum.name: MODE3
Enum.description: Mode 3: Data are captured on the clock falling edge and data is output on a rising edge. Base level of clock is 1 (CPOL=1, CPHA=1).

BitField.name: SCKFREQ
BitField.description: SCK frequency is given as 32 MHz / (SCKFREQ + 1).

Register.name: STATUS
Register.description: Status register.

BitField.name: DPM
BitField.description: Deep power-down mode (DPM) status of external flash.

Enum.name: Disabled
Enum.description: External flash is not in DPM.

BitField.name: READY
BitField.description: Ready status.

Enum.name: READY
Enum.description: QSPI peripheral is ready. It is allowed to trigger new tasks, writing custom instructions or enter/exit DPM.

Enum.name: BUSY
Enum.description: QSPI peripheral is busy. It is not allowed to trigger any new tasks, writing custom instructions or enter/exit DPM.

BitField.name: SREG
BitField.description: Value of external flash device Status Register. When the external flash has two bytes status register this field includes the value of the low byte.

Register.name: DPMDUR
Register.description: Set the duration required to enter/exit deep power-down mode (DPM).

BitField.name: ENTER
BitField.description: Duration needed by external flash to enter DPM. Duration is given as ENTER * 256 * 62.5 ns.

BitField.name: EXIT
BitField.description: Duration needed by external flash to exit DPM. Duration is given as EXIT * 256 * 62.5 ns.

Register.name: ADDRCONF
Register.description: Extended address configuration.

BitField.name: OPCODE
BitField.description: Opcode that enters the 32-bit addressing mode.

BitField.name: BYTE0
BitField.description: Byte 0 following opcode.

BitField.name: BYTE1
BitField.description: Byte 1 following byte 0.

BitField.name: MODE
BitField.description: Extended addressing mode.

BitField.name: WIPWAIT
BitField.description: Wait for write complete before sending command.

BitField.name: WREN
BitField.description: Send WREN (write enable opcode 0x06) before instruction.

Register.name: CINSTRCONF
Register.description: Custom instruction configuration register.

BitField.name: OPCODE
BitField.description: Opcode of Custom instruction.

BitField.name: LENGTH
BitField.description: Length of custom instruction in number of bytes.

BitField.name: LIO2
BitField.description: Level of the IO2 pin (if connected) during transmission of custom instruction.

BitField.name: LIO3
BitField.description: Level of the IO3 pin (if connected) during transmission of custom instruction.

BitField.name: WIPWAIT
BitField.description: Wait for write complete before sending command.

BitField.name: WREN
BitField.description: Send WREN (write enable opcode 0x06) before instruction.

BitField.name: LFEN
BitField.description: Enable long frame mode. When enabled, a custom instruction transaction has to be ended by writing the LFSTOP field.

BitField.name: LFSTOP
BitField.description: Stop (finalize) long frame transaction

Register.name: CINSTRDAT0
Register.description: Custom instruction data register 0.

BitField.description: Data byte 0

BitField.name: BYTE1
BitField.description: Data byte 1

BitField.name: BYTE2

Register.name: CINSTRDAT1

BitField.description: Data byte 5

Register.name: IFTIMING
Register.description: SPI interface timing.

BitField.name: RXDELAY
BitField.description: Timing related to sampling of the input serial data. The value of RXDELAY specifies the number of 64 MHz cycles (15.625 ns) delay from the the rising edge of the SPI Clock (SCK) until the input serial data is sampled. As en example, if set to 0 the input serial data is sampled on the rising edge of SCK.

Register.name: HOST_CRYPTOKEY_SEL
Register.description: AES hardware key select

BitField.name: HOST_CRYPTOKEY_SEL
BitField.description: Select the source of the HW key that is used by the AES engine

Enum.name: K_DR
Enum.description: Use device root key K_DR from CRYPTOCELL AO power domain

Register.name: HOST_IOT_KPRTL_LOCK
Register.description: This write-once register is the K_PRTL lock register. When this register is set, K_PRTL cannot be used and a zeroed key will be used instead. The value of this register is saved in the CRYPTOCELL AO power domain.

BitField.name: HOST_IOT_KPRTL_LOCK
BitField.description: This register is the K_PRTL lock register. When this register is set, K_PRTL cannot be used and a zeroed key will be used instead. The value of this register is saved in the CRYPTOCELL AO power domain.

Enum.name: Disabled
Enum.description: K_PRTL can be selected for use from register HOST_CRYPTOKEY_SEL

Enum.name: Enabled
Enum.description: K_PRTL has been locked until next power-on reset (POR). If K_PRTL is selected anyway, a zeroed key will be used instead.

Register.name: HOST_IOT_KDR0
Register.description: This register holds bits 31:0 of K_DR. The value of this register is saved in the CRYPTOCELL AO power domain. Reading from this address returns the K_DR valid status indicating if K_DR is successfully retained.

BitField.name: HOST_IOT_KDR0
BitField.description: Write: K_DR bits 31:0. Read: 0x00000000 when 128-bit K_DR key value is not yet retained in the CRYPTOCELL AO power domain. Read: 0x00000001 when 128-bit K_DR key value is successfully retained in the CRYPTOCELL AO power domain.

Register.name: HOST_IOT_KDR1
Register.description: This register holds bits 63:32 of K_DR. The value of this register is saved in the CRYPTOCELL AO power domain.

BitField.name: HOST_IOT_KDR1
BitField.description: K_DR bits 63:32

Register.name: HOST_IOT_KDR2
Register.description: This register holds bits 95:64 of K_DR. The value of this register is saved in the CRYPTOCELL AO power domain.

BitField.name: HOST_IOT_KDR2
BitField.description: K_DR bits 95:64

Register.name: HOST_IOT_KDR3
Register.description: This register holds bits 127:96 of K_DR. The value of this register is saved in the CRYPTOCELL AO power domain.

BitField.name: HOST_IOT_KDR3
BitField.description: K_DR bits 127:96

Register.name: HOST_IOT_LCS
Register.description: Controls lifecycle state (LCS) for CRYPTOCELL subsystem

BitField.name: LCS
BitField.description: Lifecycle state value. This field is write-once per reset.

BitField.name: LCS_IS_VALID
BitField.description: Read-only field. Indicates if CRYPTOCELL LCS has been successfully configured since last reset.

Enum.name: Invalid
Enum.description: Valid LCS not yet retained in the CRYPTOCELL AO power domain

Enum.name: Valid
Enum.description: Valid LCS successfully retained in the CRYPTOCELL AO power domain

Register.name: IFTIMING.RXDELAY
Register.description: Sample delay for input serial data on MISO

BitField.name: RXDELAY
BitField.description: Sample delay for input serial data on MISO. The value specifies the number of 64 MHz clock cycles (15.625 ns) delay from the the sampling edge of SCK (leading edge for CONFIG.CPHA = 0, trailing edge for CONFIG.CPHA = 1) until the input serial data is sampled. As en example, if RXDELAY = 0 and CONFIG.CPHA = 0, the input serial data is sampled on the rising edge of SCK.
